cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi SSW of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, expected to turn north-northwest and parallel the Baja California peninsula before curving just west of northern Baja and southern California late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just west of the west-central Baja California peninsula (around Punta Eugenia)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Puerto Cortes to Punta Eugenia; Tropical Storm Watch north of Santa Rosalia to Bahia de los Angeles and north of Punta Eugenia to San Jose de las Palomas (all on Baja California peninsula).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cabo San Lucas northward to Santa Rosalia and from Punta Abreojos southward to Cabo San Lucas (southern Baja).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Baja California peninsula and adjacent Pacific waters; large swell field spreading to Southern California coastline including San Diego County.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥39 mph) winds late Saturday through Sunday; otherwise breezy with gusts 25–35 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large southerly swell and rough surf (4–7 ft) with dangerous rip currents along San Diego beaches; no significant surge in the bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moisture could bring 0.5–1.5 inches of rain with localized totals near 2 inches late Saturday–Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and hazardous marine conditions could disrupt cargo handling, pilotage, and small-craft movements in and around the port.
